result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT: Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. The Court ordered all court costs, fees and surcharges are to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
Concurrent with: concurrent to any other sentence; credit for 189 days served.

superMiscConds.notes: No care responsibilities with children under 16 years old.

supervisions.notes:
02-18-2016/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner.
The Court ordered that the term of extended supervision on counts one and three is commuted to five years.  All other sentencing orders, including sentence credit, shall remain in  effect
Concurrent with: concurrent to any other sentence; credit for 189 days served.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)

Defendant's pro se request for WSAP.
Previous entry stating that a JusticePoint report was received on this case made in error. No reports were received.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Reflects 02-18-2016 Court order commuting ES on Counts 1 & 3 to five years

Order Commuting Term of Extended Supervision signed and filed.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the term of extended supervision on counts one and three is commuted to five (5) years.  All othre sentencing orders, including sentence credit, shall remain in effect.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify length of extended supervision on counts one and three.
Original SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT Transcript (22 pages) commencing JANUARY 28, 2016 received and filed.

Defendant Ruben Colon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Ruben Colon in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  


As to Counts 1 & 3:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent to any other sentence; credit for 189 days served.  Court ordered 6 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 6 YEARS Extended Supervision.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No care responsibilities with children under 16 years old.
- Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- No firearms or ammo.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. The Court ordered all court costs, fees and surcharges are to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.
ALTERNATIVE PRESENTENCE INVESTIGATION REPORT
The Court found that the defendant is competent to proceed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order for Treatment signed and filed.

Defendant Ruben Colon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Ruben Colon in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn:  Dr. John Pankiewicz.  Arguments by counsels.  The court had previously found the defendant not competent but likely to regain if treated to competency.  Based on testimony and arguments to the court, the court finds that placement at a state facility is the proper course of action and remands the defendant into the custody of DHS and to be transported to state facility for treatment to competency.  The court will set a return of report date on 12-10-2015 at 8:15 (Atty Harris is not available after that date until the new year).  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Atty Harris contacted the court to advise that his trials in Waukesha have resolved for Sept. 29 and that he will be available to appear for hearing.
Clerk contacted Forensic Unit to confirm Dr. Pankiewicz is available for testimony.
Clerk contacted ADA DeSiato.

Defendant Ruben Colon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Ruben Colon in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Dr. report dated 9-18-2015 is reviewed by all parties and there are no challenges.  The court will adopt the opinion that to a reasonable degree of medical certainty the defendant is not competent to proceed but likely to regain competency if treated. The court will remand the defendant into the custody of DHS for treatment to competency.  Defense counsel objects and requests that the defendant be referred to OCRP.  The court will schedule a hearing for Dr. Pankiewicz to provide testimony.
Clerk contacted the Forensic Unit for doctor's availability which is not until Tuesday, September 29.  Court will set a hearing on that date at 8:15.  Defendant is remanded until the next date.  Defense counsel informs the court that he will be in Waukesha County that date for trials.
Atty Harris requested (OFF THE RECORD) if he could appear telephonically on the 29th, however, that is not possible as defendant would have no way to commicate with him.
Clerk contacted  Atty Harris later in the morning and was informed that he has FPT's on this trials set for the 29th this Thursday and should know the status of being able to appear 9-29-2015.  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ruben Colon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing arguments made. For reasons stated on the record by defense counsel, the Court ordered that there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed to sentencing, and pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered the defendant be examined by the Forensic Unit (Dr. Pankiewicz as he completed the original evaluation).  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned to Branch 38, future date was selected by the Court.

Letters concerning the defendant's treatment received and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
GPS Supervision is ordered withdrawn, per the Court.   mld

Defendant Ruben Colon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin 
with Sarah Zawach (under the student practice rule).  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #2 and #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1 and #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 9-10-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.

Defense Motion to Vacate GPS Supervision, with no objection by the State, is heard and granted by the Court.

All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.  The Court warned defendant that any violations may result with him going into custody.  mld
